Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: The message was cheered on by several community members and organizations such as the East Oakland Collective nonprofit.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: several community members and organizations such as the East Oakland Collective nonprofit

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Update at 4:32 p.m.: According to a post by Love on Instagram earlier this hour, the judge did not rule in Love’s favor.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: According to a post by Love on Instagram earlier this hour

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “While we are disappointed by the court’s decision not to place us on the ballot in November, I remain undeterred in my commitment to serving Oakland and our communities,” she wrote. “My dedication to our city does not begin nor end with a campaign. There are many ways to effect change and ensure our voices are heard. I will continue to work alongside each of you, advocating for public health, safety, and equitable development in Oakland.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: she wrote

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Tonya Love, former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife, failed to qualify for the council race earlier this month because she hadn’t gathered enough signatures.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Love’s lawyers, from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group, said in their petition that Love had gathered 67 signatures in total and that three of the signatures were unfairly disqualified.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: lawyers from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “These technical errors should not prevent the intent of the voters from being realized and the signatures counted towards verification,” the lawyers stated in their brief.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: lawyers from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: the lawyers stated in their brief

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The county attorneys countered in a brief that the state election code deems signatures on a nomination form invalid if they don’t include a signature and a printed name and if the address of the candidate’s supporter is not consistent with their voter registration form.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: county attorneys
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: countered in a brief

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: After hearing both sides this morning in county court, Alameda County Superior Court Judge Michael Markman said he would issue his ruling by 3 p.m. today.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Alameda County Superior Court Judge
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: After hearing both sides this morning in county court

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “My understanding is that there are other candidates for this particular district city council who would’ve liked the opportunity to have more time to gather and submit signatures, and the process needs to be uniform,” he said. “In its implementation, it looks like the ROV attempted to do that here.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Alameda County Superior Court Judge
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: he said

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The judge also noted that he was wary of approving the request lest it turn the courts into “a clearing house for attempting to verify signatures.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Alameda County Superior Court Judge
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The judge also noted

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “There are only three in this one,” he said, “but I can imagine scenarios where it could be 23 in future cases.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Alameda County Superior Court Judge
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: he said

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The lawyer representing Love said that the judge could limit his ruling to the type of unusual last-minute circumstance this represents, in which a candidate had only a couple of days to gather signatures.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: lawyer
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The lawyer representing Love said

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: If the signatures are validated, Love will become a candidate in a five-person race for a seat that opened up only because of a last-minute decision by sitting Councilmember Treva Reid not to run for reelection, citing the increasing health care needs of her mother.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: sitting Councilmember
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a last-minute decision by sitting Councilmember Treva Reid not to run for reelection, citing the increasing health care needs of her mother

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: After Reid dropped out, Love, who had already qualified for the at-large councilmember race against 10 other candidates, decided to switch her candidacy to District 7, where she lives and where her political connections might give her a better path to victory.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: After Reid dropped out, Love, who had already qualified for the at-large councilmember race against 10 other candidates

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Her lawyers also argued that the district has a low number of registered voters, making it harder for her to secure as many signatures.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: lawyers from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Her lawyers also argued

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: A few other candidates in the last-minute scramble were able to gather enough signatures to qualify for the ballot, among them Ken Houston.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: candidate
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: A few other candidates in the last-minute scramble were able to gather enough signatures to qualify for the ballot

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: One person who tried but failed to gather enough signatures to run for the district seat was David Newton, a nephew of Black Panther Party founder Huey Newton.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: nephew of Black Panther Party founder Huey Newton
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: One person who tried but failed to gather enough signatures to run for the district seat

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: In an interview with The Oaklandside last week, Newton was resigned to his failure to gather enough signatures–he picked up 37–but said he would work with whoever came out ahead in the race to help improve the community.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: nephew of Black Panther Party founder Huey Newton
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: In an interview with The Oaklandside last week

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: While on Fife’s staff, Love worked on the city’s COVID-19 budgeting and most recently helped shepherd Fife’s work with local community advocates on developing a legal tactical urbanism community pilot.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: While on Fife’s staff, Love worked on the city’s COVID-19 budgeting and most recently helped shepherd Fife’s work with local community advocates on developing a legal tactical urbanism community pilot

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: After Love’s lawyers submitted their petition on Aug. 20, the Alameda Court originally set a conference for September 24, but lawyers for the county asked for the hearing to be moved up to today, to ensure there was enough time to create the ballots.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: lawyers
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: lawyers for the county asked for the hearing to be moved up to today, to ensure there was enough time to create the ballots

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: In an Instagram post last week, Love told her followers her team had written a petition to validate her application to run for the district seat. She thanked the Oakland City Clerk and the city attorney for helping her through the process.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: In an Instagram post last week, Love told her followers her team had written a petition to validate her application to run for the district seat

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We are moving forward because our campaign is committed to fighting for equity and social justice for our community in District 7,” she wrote. “We believe that every resident deserves to be represented and have access to the resources and opportunities to thrive.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: she wrote

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Alameda County Registrar is scheduled to send the final ballot for printing on Friday.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: The Alameda County Registrar is scheduled to send the final ballot for printing on Friday
